meanings.definition: To ask a question or raise doubts about something.
meanings.sent1: She questioned the teacher about the homework assignment.
meanings.sent2: The detective questioned the suspect about his alibi.
meanings.sent3: The parrot questioned the validity of the new toy.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes questioned his true intentions.
meanings.sent5: The child questioned everything, eager to learn more.

meanings.sent1: The police officer questioned the witness at the crime scene.
meanings.sent2: During the debate, the candidate questioned his opponent's policies.
meanings.sent3: The cat questioned the dog's loyalty in their playful argument.
meanings.sent4: The waves questioned the stability of the old pier.
meanings.sent5: The teacher questioned the student to test their knowledge.

meanings.sent1: He questioned whether he had locked the door before leaving.
meanings.sent2: She questioned the accuracy of the survey results.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel questioned the safety of the new bird feeder.
meanings.sent4: The wind questioned the strength of the tree branches.
meanings.sent5: The scientist questioned the validity of the research findings.
